meanings.sent3: The naffer umbrella turned inside out in a light breeze.
meanings.sent4: The naffer phone call left her feeling empty.
meanings.sent5: The naffer shoes fell apart after just one wear.

meanings.definition: To make something appear less attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: She tried to naffer the presentation by adding too many unnecessary details.
meanings.sent2: He always naffers his photos by applying too many filters.
meanings.sent3: The magician naffered the beautiful flower into a wilted mess.
meanings.sent4: The rain naffered the once vibrant colors of the sign.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally naffered the dish by adding too much salt.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is unattractive or unappealing.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a naffer among all the glamorous guests.
meanings.sent2: The old car was considered a naffer in the showroom.
meanings.sent3: The naffer of the group always brought bad luck.
meanings.sent4: He was the naffer in the family photo, making a funny face.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was a true naffer in the neighborhood.
